item.title: How to read the Bible?
item.description: How to read and interpret the Bible is an age-old question that has been around as long as there were stories to listen to or to read. The very first interpreters of the Jewish torah (what we Christians call the Pentateuch, or first five books of our Old Testament) struggled with this. For them, there were four fundamental ways of looking at and interpreting scripture: The literal, “plain” meaning. The deep (allegoric: hidden or symbolic)Â meaning.
